text: Mars is called the Red Planet because iron minerals in its soil oxidize, giving it a rusty color.
A Martian day, called a sol, is about 24 hours and 39 minutes.
Mars has two small moons: Phobos and Deimos.
Gravity on Mars is about 38 percent of Earth's gravity.
Mars is roughly half the diameter of Earth.
Mars has a thin atmosphere made mostly of carbon dioxide.
Mars has polar ice caps made of water ice and frozen carbon dioxide.
Mars has seasons because its axis is tilted, similar to Earth.
Olympus Mons is the largest volcano in the solar system.
Valles Marineris is a canyon system about 4,000 kilometers long.
Dust storms on Mars can grow large enough to cover the entire planet.
Ancient river channels and lake beds suggest Mars once had liquid water on its surface.
Sojourner, deployed by Mars Pathfinder in 1997, was the first rover to drive on Mars.
Spirit and Opportunity landed in 2004 and explored opposite sides of Mars.
Opportunity operated for nearly 15 years and traveled over 45 kilometers.
Curiosity landed in Gale Crater in 2012 to study Mars' habitability.
Curiosity carries a chemistry lab called SAM to analyze rocks and gases.
Perseverance landed in Jezero Crater in 2021 to collect rock samples for return to Earth.
Perseverance carries the MOXIE experiment, which demonstrated making oxygen from Mars' CO2 atmosphere.
Ingenuity achieved the first powered, controlled flight on another planet.
InSight was a lander that studied Mars' interior using a seismometer.
Curiosity and Perseverance use nuclear power sources called RTGs to keep working through dusty seasons.
Spirit and Opportunity used solar panels for power.
Mars is cold and dry; nighttime temperatures can drop below minus 100 degrees Celsius.
Fine dust in the atmosphere gives the Martian sky a reddish tint.
Mars is home to the tallest mountain and some of the deepest canyons in the solar system.
Rover tracks can persist for a long time because Mars has no rain to wash them away.
Mars' atmosphere is too thin for liquid water to remain stable on the surface for long.
A Mars year lasts about 687 Earth days.
Many Mars rovers use stereo cameras to create 3D views of the terrain.
Jezero Crater contains an ancient river delta, making it a key site to search for past life.
Curiosity found evidence that Gale Crater once held long-lived lakes.
Opportunity discovered evidence that water once flowed on the surface of Mars.
Dust devils on Mars can clean solar panels and extend rover lifetimes.
